data.prayer: Spirit, give the believers of the the state of Wele-Nzas unity and humility as they work to bring the kingdom to new people and places.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Wele-Nzas, Equatorial Guinea
data.section_summary: What people or resources could you pray for in this photo?

data.prayer: Spirit, please convict each believer in Wele-Nzas, Equatorial Guinea to take up their calling as a priesthood of believers and pray for the 149,580 lost around them.
data.verse: you also, like living stones, are being built into a spiritual house to be a holy priesthood

data.label_1: One disciple of Jesus for every 21 lost neighbors

data.prayer: Father, encourage your church in Wele-Nzas that you never forsake them.
data.verse: Those who know your name will put their trust in you, for you, Yahweh, have not forsaken those who seek you.

data.prayer: Lord, help the people of Wele-Nzas, Equatorial Guinea to discover the essence of being a disciple, making disciples, and how to plant churches that multiply.

data.focus_label: Pray for the city of Añisoc
data.prayer: Pray that God raises up new churches in the city of Añisoc, Wele-Nzas, Equatorial Guinea.
Spirit, teach those feeling unsafe in Wele-Nzas, Equatorial Guinea that they can hide under your wings
data.verse: He will cover you with his feathers, and under his wings you will find refuge; his faithfulness will be your shield and rampart.

data.prayer: Spirit, help get online Bibles and Bible apps onto the phones of the 132,728 people who claim to know you, so they can read everyday.

data.section_summary:
the state of Wele-Nzas, Equatorial Guinea has a population of 157,000.

We estimate Wele-Nzas has 7,420 people who might know Jesus, 132,728 people who might know about Jesus culturally, and 16,852 people who do not know Jesus.

This is 1 believer for every 21 neighbors who need Jesus.

data.prayer: Jesus, please give your people in Wele-Nzas, Equatorial Guinea a passion for the lost.
data.verse: We are therefore Christ’s ambassadors, as though God were making his appeal through us. We implore you on Christ’s behalf: Be reconciled to God.
